item.title: Soulsplit client background change! C&P!
item.dc:creator: @Pietz Pietz
item.description:
@Pietz wrote:

Quick tutoriial. DO NOT CAL ME A LEECHER I DO NOT LEECH I MADE THIS GUIDE AND UPLOADED ALL THE FILES COMPLETELY.

** Part 1 is just to change it back to the original background **
** Part 2 is to change to your own background **

Diifficulty: 1/10
Knowledge: 0/10 (Copy and Paste)

Virus scan…

Before we start download this .rar file and extract it to get the folder.
http://www.mediafire.com/?7xllav3e5kljs59

Step one: Find your cache file in your client file, this could be name: soulsplit, soulsplit1, SSC, SSC2, or SSCACHE.

Step two: Delete the following files:
main_file_cache.dat
main_file_cache.idx0
main_file_cache.idx1
main_file_cache.idx2
main_file_cache.idx3
main_file_cache.idx4

And now open the downloaded folded and copy those files into your cache files, and your done!

Part 2

find in Sprite.java (Soul Split Server + Client/Client) :

public Sprite(byte abyte0[], Component component)

After replace the entire method with this one:

public Sprite(byte abyte0[], Component component) { try { Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./Background.png"); MediaTracker mediatracker = new MediaTracker(component); mediatracker.addImage(image, 0); mediatracker.waitForAll(); myWidth = image.getWidth(component); myHeight = image.getHeight(component); anInt1444 = myWidth; anInt1445 = myHeight; anInt1442 = 0; anInt1443 = 0; myPixels = new int[myWidth * myHeight]; PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, myWidth, myHeight, myPixels, 0, myWidth); pixelgrabber.grabPixels(); } catch(Exception _ex) { System.out.println(_ex); } }

After you have a background made save it as/ rename it “Background.png” and paste/save it into your client files.

100% Credits to I Am Sanity for part 1

100% Credits for me for part 2

Comment if this helped! And best of luck with your server!

Read full topic
